our Springboard Spotlight page cerrjspridD emaildomainshagfinalimagesorangesections pacegif Write Stuff It takes more than water and flame retardant to put out forest fires Reade r and firefighter Paul F tells us how his Visor Prism helped rescue a crew member and keep the flames at bay emaildomainshagfinalimageslinespacegif Jump in the Fire I am a smokejumper for the US Forest Service cerrjsp ridD in Missoula Montana For t hose who may not know smokejumpers are airborne forest fire fighters that parachute into remote mountainous terrain to fight wild fires As a Forem an for the Missoula Smokejumpers I manage several programs and coordinate s everal projects My Visor helps me to stay on top of all that administrativ e work but more unique is how it helps me on fires My Prism was particula rly helpful on one fire this last summer emaildomainshagfinalimagesparachute jpgWe had a late afternoon dispatch to the Gallatin National Forest just n orth of Yellowstone National Park in early Augustanother lightning ignited fire We were flying over the scene about one hour after receiving the cal l As the airplane circled the fire I noticed a couple of small spot fires quite a distance from the main fire I had my Prism out with the Magellan G PS cerrjspridD Module installed so I quickly marked a couple of waypoints as we flew over the spots Within a few minutes we were leaping out of the aircraft an d floating down to our jump spot about a half mile from the fire Unfortuna tely one of our fellow crewmembers was hurt on landing and because no heli copter ambulances were available in the area we were forced to utilize the Malmstrom Air Force air rescue helicopter about four hours away With my P rism and GPS unit I was able to gather the latitude and longitude coordinat es of our location I had the phone number for the th Air Rescue Squadron in my address book and thus was able to call them up direct on our satelli te phone and arrange for the evacuation of the injured jumpergiving them a ll the pertinent information including our location The next day I grabbed pictures of the fire with my eyemodule tcomcerrjspridD The fire made some impressive runs as the day warmed up making for some dandy photo opportunities but making for tough firefighting Luckily with some fast ac tion and hard work on our part we were able to get the fire under control as the evening cooled The pictures I captured with the eyemodule helped t o make a very complete fire report at the end of the fire The next morning Day I again used the GPS We had been unable to find t he spots wed seen from the airplane by gridding for them as they were no longer showing any smoke However I was able to locate the spot fires that I had marked as waypoints from the air And it was a good thing too Two o f the spots still had hot embers in them and thus had potential to kick up and burn Well as you can see a Handspring Visor Prism can be a pretty useful tool even in some pretty unlikely places All that and I could even play Solit aire when we got a chance to kick back and take a break Paul F Missoula Smokejumpers Aerial Fire Depot emaildomainshagfinalimagesblacksectionsp communicator cerrjsprid lets you stay in touch when you just cant talk on the phone This week well look at how it lets you surf the webwithout wires Bandwidth on the Run For most people the experience of surfing the web wirelessly has been more akin to wading in the shallow end of a pool Even when youre able to access one of the select few websites that have been optimized for WAP wireless application protocol tiny mobile phone screens often mean endlessly scrolling through blocks of text one small line at a time The Treo communicator changes all that emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif The Treo communicator comes loaded with Blazer cerrjsprid the latest version of Handsprings awardwinning web browser for the Palm OS Blazer lets you securely view virtually any HTML cHTML or WAP web site in its entiretywith full text and graphics formatted to look great on your Treo screen So the content you see on your Treo communicator is the same as what you would find on your desktop computer Plus you can bookmark up to fifty sites so the information you want the most is always at your fingertips emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif cerrjsprid Take movie listings news headlinesand shopping deals with you onthego cerrjsprid emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif Even if youve never accessed the web from a mobile device before Treo makes it easy to see why you would want to Imagine having instant access to a map when you get lost on the road Or checking a stock quote during a power lunch Or reading the top headlines on your way to work Or buying movie tickets on the way to the theater The Treo communicator lets you do all this and so much morewherever you are emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif The Word Is Out Want to hear what others have to say about Treo Heres a small sampling emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif Tips Tricks Cutting out just a few little steps now can save you heaps of time in the long run Customize Your Synchronization You can shave time off your HotSync operation by only synchronizing the programs you actually use Dont use the Expense application Never read your email on the road Dont waste precious synchronization time Just open the Palm Desktop choose the HotSync dropdown menu and click Custom Youll get a list of all the applications that synchronize Simply change the ones you no longer need from Synchronize the files to Do Nothing and youre ready to start saving time If you liked this tip you can let us know by clicking here cerrjsprid emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif Set Time Dialogue Box When youre setting the time of an event with the Set Time dialogue box you dont have to navigate up and down the vertical hour and minute bars You can just tap the Start Time or End Time box and use your Graffiti pad to enter the times If you liked this tip you can let us know by clicking here cerrjsprid emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif Write Stuff With over Palm OS applications just waiting to be downloaded theres literally no end to the ways you can use your Visor handheld Find out how reader Matthew S used his to calculate complex traffic problems for Calgarys Transportation Department Visor Gets the Green Light This summer I had the privilege of working for the Transportation Department of the City of Calgary here in Calgary Canada One of the projects I aided was a study into the startup delays of vehicles once the traffic light turns green There can be as much as a five second delay between when the light turns green and the rear axel of the first vehicle in the queue crossing into the intersection This delay must be taken into account when trying to establish a value for the number of cars that can make it through a light in an hour of green time This value in turn is used in many intersection decisions Our task was to determine how many cars would make it through the intersection in one hour of green time one hour of green time is the sum of the green times during each red yellow green phase until they total one hour For this study I downloaded a program SportsWatch v cerrjsprid onto my Handspring Visor Deluxe which allowed us to record every car crossing something that would have been impossible with a simple stopwatch It allowed us to time the crossing of the rear axel for every car in the queue since when you hit the lap button it records the time elapsed and outputs it as text From here it is a simple matter of copying the results to a memo in memo pad and saving Back at the office we were able to synchronize the Handspring Visor with the Palm Desktop software and the memos containing the information were suddenly digital documents with no laborious data entry needed The results could be cut and pasted into a simple MS Excel spreadsheet to be analyzed and used in our study This made for a more complete dataset and hopefully more credible conclusions As well the cumbersome task of entering the recorded data was avoided by utilizing the quick and simple synchronization system saving us a considerable amount of time The Handspring Visor helped to make the data collection process more complete easier to accomplish and more efficient to import after collection Send Us Your Stories and Pictures If youd like to share a story of how you use your Visor handheld at work home or play send us an email at If you have a question relating to great tools games and more emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif Tips Tricks Every quarter we like to republish popular tips and tricks as voted upon by you Here are the top three tips from last autumns enewslettersback by popular demand emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif emaildomainshagfinalimagesnumbergifDrag and Drop Memos emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif Memo Pad automatically numbers your memos but you can also manually change the order in which the memos appear by dragging and dropping them Simply hold down the stylus on the memo and drag it to where you want it to go emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif emaildomainshagfinalimagesnumbergifBeaming Your Business Card emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif When you beam your business card any attached note will be beamed along with it Have a resume or a favorite quotation up to characters that youd like to share with others Simply attach it as a note to your business card emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif emaildomainshagfinalimagesnumbergifFloating Events emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif Floating events in Date Book Plus let you set appointments that float with you through the calendar appearing each day until youve finally completed the task or event Use floating events anytime you have a task or appointment that isnt necessarily fixed to a certain date Like picking up dry cleaningit may be ready on Monday but who knows when youll actually have time to pick it up In Day View just tap New then tap Floating Event from the popup menu and enter the name of the event Your new floating event will appear as a circle on your Day View until you delete it emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif Write Stuff Many of us keep in touch with the office when were on the road but enewsletter subscriber Cynthia takes it to a whole new level Biking CrossCountry with My Visor Handheld Im a partner for a graphic design firm Taking three months off to bicycle from Washington DC to Florence Oregon would put a strain on the company But my partner and our staff had given me their you go girl blessing They even built a special section of our corporate web site to highlight the trip noteworthybeyondhtml cerrjsprid The plan was to post our journal as we moved across the country It was a beautiful design now the pressure was on for me to do the writing and get it back to them Thats where my Visor came in With a collapsible keyboard and modem module we had a lightweight package of technology that would fit into my bag and keep us connected We also carried a backup module to insure we wouldnt lose data when batteries ran low and we were miles from a store I learned to set up my traveling office on picnic tables in our tent on diner tables surrounded by pancakes and eggs in country churches and steamy laundromats We stayed in a motel once a week and hooked up the modem to send the weeks entries back home We also collected email messages from folks who were following our progress As the weeks and miles added up we realized through this connection how many people were rooting for us and following our unfolding story emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif emaildomainshagfinalimagesbikingjpg emaildomainshagfinalimagesspacergif We feel lucky to have lived out a long time dream Now in the middle of winter I sometimes open my Visor click back to a random summer day and savor the memories into the possibilities of Graffiti with these handy tips emaildomainshagfinalimagesblacksectionspacegif Graffiti Tip Extended Shift Characters You already know that you can capitalize a letter by preceding it with an upstroke And that you just need to tap once in the Graffiti space for a Punctuation Shift But there are also characters you can access with the Extended Shifta downward stroke from the top left to the bottom rightincluding quotation marks trademarks bullets and foreign currency To view all characters in this set tap Menu then Edit then Graffiti Help Press the scroll down button four times and there they are If you liked this tip you can let us know by clicking here cerrjsprid emaildomainshagfinalimagesblacksectionspacegif Graffiti Tip Accented Characters You can also create accented characters with Graffiti To find out how tap Menu then Edit then Graffiti Help Press the scroll down button five times and follow the directions on the screen If you liked this tip you can let us know by clicking here cerrjsprid emaildomainshagfinalimagesblacksectionspacegif Module Tip Audible Advisor Ready to advance to the next audio program on your Audible Advisor Simply press and hold the Up and Down buttons on your Visor handheld for more than second and youll be there If you liked this tip you can let us know by clicking here cerrjsprid emaildomainshagfinalimagesorangesectionspacegif Write Stuff New dad David D tells us how the Visor Edge handheld helped his wife deliver one of the first babies of the New Year emaildomainshagfinalimagesblacksectionspacegif Baby New Year My wife Jenny and I were expecting our first child together on January st For her birthday last July I gave her a Visor handheld and she has found several wonderful uses for it in her third grade classroom For my birthday in August she in turn purchased a Visor for me At that time Jenny was months pregnant and I was looking for programs that could help keep track of our busy lives as well as help us keep track of the pending event I used the Memo Pad to keep tabs on things we already had and items we still needed to pack for the hospital I eventually found a program online called Labor Timer It is so simple to use All you do is push the onscreen Start or Stop button and it automatically calculates the start time of the contraction the length of the contraction and the time between each contraction We used it to practice so that I could work on my coaching techniques as we were planning a natural drugfree delivery On Christmas Day Jenny started having contractions We used her Visor and the Labor Timer to monitor the contractions but that was not to be the day Again on the th she had contractions and again no baby However throughout the day on New Years Eve her contractions were very consistent That night after we rang in the New Year she felt very strongly that this might be the night As I went to sleep Jenny used her Visor and the Labor Timer to keep track of her contractions At am she said it was time to head for the hospital Throughout the wee hours of the morning I used my Visor Edge to keep track of the contractions as we paced the halls of the hospital The staff was impressed at how I was able to keep such accurate details as we roamed up and down the halls of Labor and Delivery I fessed up and showed them the program running on my Visor At pm January st our daughter Zoe Grace was born I am happy to report Mom Zoe and Dad are all doing great Now I can use the financial calculator to plan for her college tuition and Ill need to get an eyemodule to take pictures for emailing and David D emaildomainshagfinalimagesblacksectionspacegif Send Us Your Stories and Pictures If youd like to share a
